The basic Jekyll site structure and configuration files have been created in the docs-foo directory. The site uses the clean, well-supported 'just-the-docs' theme and is configured with some common Jekyll plugins.

The homepage includes navigation links to the main content sections, and placeholders have been added for API docs, guides, and tutorials under the respective collections.

The README provides instructions for building the site locally, adding new pages, and deploying updates.

I've created the docs-foo/api directory structure with:

- index.md as the API documentation hub with an overview and module links
- core.md as an example module page documenting methods, parameters, examples 
- api-conventions.md covering common API patterns like error handling and authentication

The files are organized so developers can easily navigate the API reference, understand the overall structure, and dive into specific modules and methods as needed.
